xml-rules.title: XML Syntax rules
xml-rules.title2: 6 important rules that must be adhered to in order to create a valid XML file:

rule.heading: XML Documents Must Have a Root Element
rule.description: XML documents must contain one root element that is the parent of all other elements.

rule.heading: The XML Prolog
rule.description: The XML prolog is optional. If it exists, it must come first in the document.

rule.heading: All XML Elements Must Have a Closing Tag
rule.description: In XML, it is illegal to omit the closing tag. All elements must have a closing tag.

rule.heading: XML Tags are Case Sensitive
rule.description: XML tags are case sensitive. The tag <Letter> is different from the tag <letter>.

rule.heading: XML Elements Must be Properly Nested
rule.description: In XML, all elements must be properly nested within each other.

rule.heading: XML Attribute Values Must Always be Quoted
rule.description: XML elements can have attributes in name/value pairs just like in HTML. In XML, the attribute values must always be quoted.
